field.name: summary
field.value: no id=# on links to edit and confirm actions when of the scaffolding

field.name: description
field.value:
When using scaffolding and you are in the list action, the links to the edit and confirm actions do not have a '?id=#' query string attached. I fixed it with creating the query string to the method that builds the dictionary for the link, in the presentationhelper class (see attached patch):
+ IDictionary querystring = DictHelper.CreateN("id", key); + dict["querystring"] = UrlHelper.BuildQueryString(querystring);
This works for me, however i do not know if this is the right way to solve this as im very new to MR. It looks strange to me to add both the id and a query string with the id to the dict. I also don't know how this behaves with routing.
for more info, please see this thread on the user list: http://groups.google.com/group/castle-project-users/browse_thread/thread/95229bfc75785752/ca0d735294778334?hl=en&lnk=gst&q=scaffolding#ca0d735294778334
